Note: This solution is obtained by “tracing‐through” every transaction chronologically – deducting cash and bank‐balance outflows for payments (by cash or bank transfer), adding purchased inventory when goods are bought (whether paid immediately or on account), recording sales (with increases either in cash or accounts receivable), accumulating depreciation and interest receivable entries, and accumulating the profit into retained earnings. The above numbers are approximate “book‐values” computed step–by–step from the provided transactions.
